Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    The player class represents a player in a game of Yahtzee. This class uses the Hand and Scorecard classes CPSC 224-01, Spring 2020 Homework #4 No Sources to cite
    Version:
    v4.0 03/26/20
    Author:
    Eric Gustin

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int curr_turn
      curr_turns represents the player's current turn in a hand of Yahtzee
      private Hand hand
      hand represents the player's hand of dice
      private int NUM_OF_TURNS
      NUM_OF_TURNS represents the number of turns allowed for a single hand of Yahtzee
      private Scorecard scorecard
      scorecard represents the player's scorecard

      Constructor for the Player class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public hw4.Player(int num_of_dice,
              int num_of_sides,
              int num_of_turns)
        Constructor for the Player class. Creates a new hand and scorecard object, and initializes NUM_OF_TURNS, curr_turn, play_again_status, and dice_to_keep
        Parameters:
        num_of_dice - represents the number of dice in a player's hand
        num_of_sides - represents the number of sides on a die
        num_of_turns - represents the number of turns per hand

        getPlayerHand is a getter function for the hand object. Calls Hand.getHand()
        Returns:
        hand.getHand() the player's hand of dice

        Rolls a single die
        Parameters:
        dieIndex - index of the die to roll in the player's hand

        sortHand calls the sortHand() method on the player's hand
